item.title: 中美贸易紧张局势升级对泰国经济增长构成巨大风险--央行副行长
item.description: 泰国央行副行长表示，中美贸易紧张局势的新一轮爆发对泰国经济增长前景构成了巨大风险，并补充说，进一步降低利率的空间已经所剩无几。【原文：The fresh flare-up in trade tensions between the United States and China is a big risk to the outlook for Thailand's economic growth, the country's deputy central bank governor said, adding there was little room left to lower rates further.】

item.title: 贝森特：美国投资热潮是可持续的
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周三表示，对美国经济的投资浪潮是可持续的，而且才刚刚开始，但联邦政府关门正日益成为一个障碍。【原文：The wave of investment into the U.S. economy is sustainable and is only getting started, but the federal government shutdown is increasingly an impediment, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）战略主管：美国和中国仍致力于全球债务工作
item.description: 美国和中国的高级官员将参加周三举行的全球主权债务圆桌会议，会议的一个重要议题是银行贷款缺乏透明度，这使发展中国家的债务重组工作变得更加复杂。【原文：Top U.S. and Chinese officials will join Wednesday's meeting of the Global Sovereign Debt Roundtable, where a key topic will be the lack of transparency about bank loans that have complicated developing countries' debt restructuring efforts.】

item.title: 诺和诺德与 Omeros 签订价值 21 亿美元的许可协议，共同推动罕见病领域的发展
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）和奥默罗斯（Omeros）周三表示，双方已签署了一项价值高达 21 亿美元的许可协议，以获得这家美国公司正在开发的治疗罕见血液和肾脏疾病的实验性药物。【原文：Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk and Omeros have signed a licensing deal worth up to $2.1 billion for the U.S.-based company's experimental drug, which is being developed for rare blood and kidney disorders, they said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美元树公司预测 2026 财年盈利乐观，重申年度目标
item.description: 美元树公司（Dollar Tree）周三预测 2026 财年的利润将高于华尔街的预期，并维持其年度目标，这表明市场对平价杂货和必需品的需求稳定。【原文：Dollar Tree on Wednesday forecast fiscal 2026 profit above Wall Street estimates and upheld its annual targets, signaling steady demand for affordable groceries and essentials.】

item.title: 标普全球斥资 18 亿美元收购私募市场公司 With Intelligence
item.description: S&P Global 公司周三表示，该公司已同意收购私募市场数据提供商 With Intelligence 公司，以拓展其为快速增长的金融服务领域提供的产品。【原文：S&P Global has agreed to buy private markets data provider With Intelligence, the company said on Wednesday, as it looks to expand its products for the fast-growing segment of financial services.】

item.title: 美国银行是 First Brands 破产贷款人之一，首席财务官称贷款有担保
item.description: 美国银行首席财务官阿拉斯泰尔-博思威克（Alastair Borthwick）周三表示，美国银行是破产的美国汽车零部件供应商First Brands的贷款财团之一，但这些贷款有强有力的抵押支持。【原文：Bank of America is among a consortium of lenders to bankrupt U.S. auto parts supplier First Brands, but the loans are backed by strong collateral, Chief Financial Officer Alastair Borthwick said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 麻省理工学院衍生公司 Vertical Semiconductor 为人工智能动力芯片技术融资 1100 万美元
item.description: 从麻省理工学院（Massachusetts Institute of Technology）分拆出来的创业公司垂直半导体公司（Vertical Semiconductor）周三表示，该公司筹集了 1100 万美元资金，用于将芯片技术商业化，以便更高效地为人工智能服务器供电。【原文：Vertical Semiconductor, a startup spun out of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, on Wednesday said it raised $11 million in funding to commercialize chip technology that can deliver electricity to artificial intelligence servers more efficiently.】

item.title: 美国地区性银行 PNC 因利息收入和费用增加而利润大增
item.description: 受利息收入增加和费用全面飙升的推动，PNC Financial 周三公布第三季度利润增长超过 21%。【原文：PNC Financial reported a more than 21% rise in third-quarter profit on Wednesday, driven by higher interest income and across-the-board jump in fees.】

item.title: 贝莱德与英伟达支持的集团达成 400 亿美元数据中心交易，助推人工智能热潮
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）、英伟达（Nvidia）、xAI 和微软（Microsoft）等公司周三表示，一个投资财团将收购 Aligned Data Centers，交易价值 400 亿美元。【原文：An investment consortium that includes BlackRock , Nvidia , xAI and Microsoft will acquire Aligned Data Centers in a deal worth $40 billion, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 雅培收入不及预期，诊断设备需求疲软
item.description: 雅培公司本周三公布的季度营收低于分析师预期，原因是诊断和营养品业务的疲软未能抵消对医疗器械的强劲需求。【原文：Abbott's quarterly revenue fell short of analysts' expectations on Wednesday, as weakness in its diagnostics and nutritional businesses failed to offset strong demand for its medical devices.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利因投资银行业务复苏而利润大增
item.description: 摩根士丹利第三季度利润增长，原因是其投资银行家的交易量回升。【原文：Morgan Stanley's profit rose in the third quarter as its investment bankers rode a resurgence in dealmaking.】

item.title: Stellantis 在美国的 130 亿美元投资计划赢得投资者和分析师的认可
item.description: 投资者和分析师周三表示，Stellantis 公司在美国的 130 亿美元新投资计划标志着对抗唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统征收关税和重振汽车制造商在其主要市场销售的关键一步。【原文：Stellantis' new $13 billion investment plan in the U.S. marks a key step to countering tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump and to reviving the automakers' sales in its main market, investors and analysts said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷制造 "工厂关闭，为 Milei 带来更多挑战
item.description: 几十年来，Lumilagro 公司凭借其标志性的钢制或玻璃保温杯在阿根廷人中大受欢迎，阿根廷人经常用这种保温杯装热水来冲泡马黛茶，马黛茶是当地无处不在的花草茶。【原文：For decades, Lumilagro rode to prosperity on the popularity of its signature steel or glass thermoses Argentines use to carry hot water to make mate, the locally ubiquitous herbal tea.】

item.title: 美国银行投资银行业务强劲，利润上升
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）表示，由于其投资银行家通过为大型交易提供顾问服务而赚得盆满钵满，该行第三季度利润有所增长。【原文：Bank of America said its profit rose in the third quarter, as its investment bankers earned big from advising on mega deals.】

item.title: 美联储抚慰贸易战的刺痛
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 谷物贸易商邦吉公司（Bunge）在完成 Viterra 交易后上调全年利润预期
item.description: 美国谷物贸易商和加工商邦吉公司（Bunge）周三修订了全年调整后利润预期，以反映其第三季度以 340 亿美元收购谷物装卸商 Viterra 的影响。【原文：U.S. grain trader and processor Bunge on Wednesday revised its full-year adjusted profit forecast to reflect the impact of its $34 billion acquisition of grain handler Viterra in the third quarter.】

item.title: 华尔街期货受芯片股提振上涨；银行业盈利成为焦点
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货上涨，原因是芯片制造商在ASML发布财报后反弹，而投资者则在等待美国银行和摩根士丹利的财报。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Wednesday as chipmakers rallied after ASML's results, while investors awaited earnings from Bank of America and Morgan Stanley following strong reports from lenders that helped lift markets in the prior session.】

item.title: 投资者警惕可能使人工智能列车脱轨的风险
item.description: 对人工智能盈利潜力的乐观情绪助推美国股市屡创新高，但投资者正在寻找人工智能交易中可能出现的薄弱点，并确定了一些需要警惕的风险。【原文：Optimism over the profit potential of artificial intelligence has helped drive the U.S. stock market to record highs, but investors are looking for weak spots that could emerge in the AI trade and have identified some risks to watch for.】

item.title: 马斯克为特斯拉 560 亿美元酬劳打官司进入最后阶段
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的律师将于周三敦促特拉华州最高法院恢复他从特斯拉公司获得的 560 亿美元薪酬，因为在下级法院法官撤销特斯拉首席执行官创纪录的薪酬近两年后，最大的企业法律诉讼之一进入了最后阶段。【原文：Elon Musk's lawyers will urge the Delaware Supreme Court on Wednesday to restore his $56 billion pay package from Tesla , as one of the biggest corporate legal battles enters its final stage nearly two years after a lower court judge rescinded the Tesla CEO's record compensation.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔认为飞机电子设备可改善航空供应链
item.description: 供应商霍尼韦尔公司（Honeywell）的一位高级主管告诉路透社记者，航空电子产品的生产是航空供应链中的一个亮点，而某些零部件的制造仍然面临挑战。【原文：The production of electronics for aviation is a bright spot in the aerospace supply chain, whereas manufacturing of some parts still remains challenging, a senior executive at supplier Honeywell told Reuters.】

item.title: 印度塔塔通讯公司因成本上升导致季度利润下降
item.description: 印度塔塔通讯公司（Tata Communications）周三报告称，由于支出增加抵消了数据服务业务的健康增长，该公司季度利润连续第二个季度下滑。【原文：India's Tata Communications reported a second consecutive fall in its quarterly profit on Wednesday, as higher expenses countered healthy growth in its data services business.】

item.title: Waymo 明年将在伦敦推出自动驾驶打车服务
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的机器人出租车公司 Waymo 周三表示，计划于 2026 年在伦敦推出完全无人驾驶的打车服务，并希望将业务范围扩展到国际主要城市。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo plans to launch its fully driverless ride-hailing service in London in 2026, the robotaxi firm said on Wednesday, as it looks to expand its footprint to major international cities.】

item.title: 中美贸易战笼罩港口，超级油轮运费大幅上涨
item.description: 由于中美针锋相对地提高港口费，以及担心美国对中国一个主要原油码头的制裁会产生影响，超级油轮运费本周飙升，并将继续走高。【原文：Supertanker freight rates surged this week and are set to stay elevated on U.S.-China tit-for-tat hikes in port fees and concerns about the fallout from U.S. sanctions on a major Chinese crude oil terminal.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称苹果游说印度修改阻碍其扩张的税法
item.description: 据知情人士透露，苹果公司正在游说印度政府修改所得税法，以确保该公司不会因其提供给合同制造商的高端 iPhone 机器所有权而被征税，这个问题被视为其未来扩张的障碍。【原文：Apple is lobbying India's government to modify its income tax law to ensure the company is not taxed for ownership of high-end iPhone machinery it provides to its contract manufacturers, an issue seen as a hurdle to its future expansion, sources say.】

item.title: 英国 Nscale 公司与微软签订协议，将供应 20 万颗英伟达人工智能芯片
item.description: 英国人工智能集团Nscale周三表示，它与微软签署了一项协议，将交付总计约20万颗英伟达人工智能芯片。【原文：British AI group Nscale said on Wednesday it signed a deal with Microsoft to deliver a total of about 200,000 Nvidia AI chips.】

item.title: 英国凯德公司因 2023 年网络漏洞被罚款 1900 万美元
item.description: 英国外包公司 Capita 周三表示，由于在 2023 年的一次网络攻击中未能保护个人数据，该公司被处以 1400 万英镑（约合 1870 万美元）的罚款，这是与英国隐私监管机构达成的和解协议的一部分。【原文：Capita has been fined 14 million pounds ($18.7 million) for failing to protect personal data during a 2023 cyber attack, the British outsourcing firm said on Wednesday, as part of a settlement with the UK's privacy watchdog.】

item.title: ASML 首席财务官称中国销售额下降与之前的囤货无关
item.description: ASML 财务总监罗杰-达森（Roger Dassen）周三告诉记者，ASML 预计中国销售额下降的原因并不是中国客户之前的囤货。【原文：ASML's expected decline in China sales is not due to previous stockpiling by its Chinese customers, finance chief Roger Dassen told reporters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据媒体报道，中国 Sicarrier 公司推出新型芯片设计软件
item.description: 与华为（HWT.UL）关系密切的中国芯片设备制造商思卡尔（SiCarrier）的一家子公司发布了两款用于半导体设计的国产软件产品，这是中国减少对外国技术依赖的最新举措。【原文：A subsidiary of SiCarrier, a Chinese chip equipment maker with close links to Huawei (HWT.UL), unveiled two domestically developed software products for semiconductor designs, the latest move by China to reduce reliance on foreign technologies.】

item.title: 法国 Altice 拒绝法国电信运营商联合竞购 SFR
item.description: Altice 首席执行官亚瑟-德雷福斯（Arthur Dreyfuss）周三在一份备忘录中告诉员工，电信公司 SFR 的所有者 Altice 法国公司拒绝了三家法国竞争对手收购该运营商的出价，这使得一项可能刺激欧洲电信市场进一步整合的潜在交易受挫。【原文：Altice France, the owner telecoms firm SFR, has rejected a bid from three French rivals to buy the operator, Altice CEO Arthur Dreyfuss told staff in a memo on Wednesday, setting back a potential deal that could spur more consolidation in the European telecoms market.】
